result.execSummary:
Kenneth D. Anderson was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Kenneth D. Anderson was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Alex Smathers appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody pro se.  Deft wishes to waive counsel for this extradition hrg; deft wishes to proceed pro se.  Deft signs the extradition papers.  Court approves the extradition.  Deft may be surrendered to the Illinois authorities.  Bond is revoked.
PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.

01:48 PM 
  Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Chrstopher Bub.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Deft will waive extradition.   Extradition hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 11:45 am.  Br 3.  $15,000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).   jk
